intro: Premna gracilis, commonly known as slender leaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale blue, which bloom in the morning. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. Premna gracilis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some cultures.
